articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Basketball Game of DPRK, American Players
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Basketball Game of DPRK, American Players
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- A mixed basketball game of the visiting American basketball players of Harlem Globetrotters and Korean players belonging to the Hwaebul basketball team of Korean University of Physical Education took place at Ryugyong Jong Ju Yong Gymnasium on Thursday. Among the American players was ex-player of NBA Dennis Rodman.
					 Sports fans and other Pyongyang citizens packed the gymnasium to watch the game with great interest.
					
					 Among the audience were foreign diplomatic envoys, representatives of international bodies, military attaches and other foreign guests here with their families.
					
					 The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, together with his wife Ri Sol Ju, came to the gymnasium to watch the game.
					
					 The players and audience broke into thunderous cheers, greatly excited to see the game together with Kim Jong Un.
					
					  Dennis Rodman went up to the auditorium to bow to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Warmly welcoming him, Kim Jong Un let him sit next to him. 
					
					 Brett Dennis Meister and Jeffrey Raymond Munn also sat near him.
					
					 American basketball players first played a demonstration game amid great attention of the audience.
					
					 They showed a variety of special basketball skills to be highly acclaimed.
					
					 Then a mixed game of DPRK and American players took place amid elated atmosphere.
					
					 Divided into red and white teams, the players carried out fierce seesaw battle.
					
					 In the first and second rounds, the red team players won 60:47 with long-distance shooting, dunk shot and other skills.
					
					 The audience enthusiastically cheered the players as they showed amazing skills.
					
					 During breaks, women's brass band presented glamorous rhythmic formations.
					
					 National dances by Korean women artistes and a demonstration performance of Taekwon-Do players added to the cheerful mood.
					
					 Korean basketball players played the game well with American players of their teams in a coordinated way by fully displaying their techniques. American players made a good job of the game to give good impressions to the audience.
					
					 The white team combined man-to-man defence and fast break. The game ended in a draw 110:110.
					
					 Kim Jong Un applauded both teams for their nice game.
					
					 Dennis Rodman expressed thanks to Kim Jong Un, saying over the mike with excitement that his impressive Pyongyang visit is quite satisfactory and it is a great privilege for him.
					
					 He said he was very pleased to mix with Pyongyang citizens, adding that it is regrettable that the relations between the U.S. and the DPRK are not good, but Korean people are his friends and in particular, he considers Marshal Kim Jong Un a close friend.
					
					 Kim Jong Un was presented with a uniform of the Harlem Globetrotters basketball team as a gift by the American guests.
					
					 This evening Kim Jong Un was invited to a dinner hosted by the DPRK Olympic Committee in honour of Rodman and his party.
					
					 He met and conversed with them in an amicable atmosphere.
					
					 He was pleased they visited Pyongyang to provide young people of the DPRK who are fond of basketball with an opportunity of enjoying the nice game, he said.
					
					 He expressed his expectation that such sports exchange would be activated, contributing to promoting mutual understanding between the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 He welcomed their visit to the DPRK, hoping that through the visit they would become familiar with the DPRK people, especially with basketball fans.
					
					 Rodman said that it was the greatest pleasure for him to meet with Kim Jong Un and his wife for the first time for Americans.
					
					 The American basketball star hoped the sports exchange would continue between the two countries.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health, heartily thanking him for warm hospitality.
					
					 The dinner proceeded in an amicable atmosphere.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wedding Present to President of Jindallae Children's Foundation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wedding Present to President of Jindallae Children's Foundation
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent a wedding present to Jindallae Saphariny, president of the Jindallae Children's Foundation.
					 It was conveyed to Jindallae by Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, on Feb. 27.
					
					 She was deeply impressed to receive the gift, an indication of the loving care that has continued invariably. She sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health.
					
					 She expressed her willingness to devote her all to boosting up the friendship with the Korean people in the future.

articles.title: Ex-player of U.S. NBA Pay Respects to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Ex-player of U.S. NBA Pay Respects to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Ex-player of the NBA of the U.S. Dennis Rodman and his party Thursday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay respects to President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They paid high tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 They entered the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state and paid homage to them. 
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives. 
					
					 They made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: U.S. Provocation to DPRK Will Lead to Self-Ruin: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. Provocation to DPRK Will Lead to Self-Ruin: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's third nuclear test was an exercise of its legitimate sovereignty to counter the U.S. wanton infringement upon the sovereign state's right to launch a satellite for peaceful purposes.
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. keeps increasing its pressure upon the DPRK, talking about "challenge" to the international community and crying out for "preemptive nuclear attack."
					
					 The U.S. is going to stage again such nuclear war manoeuvres across south Korea from March 1 as Key Resolve and Foal Eagle with latest war hardware including a nuclear carrier flotilla and B-52 strategic bombers involved.
					
					 Such military maneuvers amount to dangerous actions to ignite a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula at any cost quite contrary to the trend of the times towards peace and stability in the region.
					
					 They are to take place at a time when the DPRK-U.S. confrontation is at an extreme phase. This is a clear indication that the U.S. old nuclear war policy towards the DPRK has finally reached the phase of its full-scale implementation.
					
					 The dark clouds of a nuclear war are hanging heavily over the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The enemies tried to cover up the criminal nature of the projected war exercises through the farce of "notifying" the DPRK "in advance", describing them as "annual and defensive". But the DPRK will never be taken in by such rhetoric.
					
					 The U.S. had better properly know who its rival is.
					
					 The Korean people are no longer what they used to be in the past when they grieved over being a stateless nation after being deprived of their beloved land due to the competition among big powers a century ago.
					
					 They defeated two imperialisms, U.S. and Japanese, in one generation, winning historic victories in the battle for the liberation of the country and the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Fully equipped with the absolute trust in their ideology, social system and cause and the strong will to devotedly defend them, heroic Korea and its people solemnly declared that whoever provokes them would never be able to escape a final ruin no matter where he is in the world.
					
					 The DPRK won victories only even without nukes in the past. The U.S. should give deep thought to provocations to the DPRK and their consequences, now that it has emerged a full-fledged nuclear weapons state.
					
					 The U.S. had better stop dreaming of compromise or concession from the DPRK.
					
					 The recent nuclear test of the DPRK was no more than the primary counteraction taken by it, exercising its maximum self-restraint towards the U.S. hostile acts.
					
					 The DPRK has already proved in practice that its will and capability are by no means an empty talk.
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK are now waiting for an order for final attack, keeping themselves highly alerted so that they may blow up the enemies' strongholds of aggression by giving full play to their tremendous combat capability if they provoke.
					
					 They have Korean-style strategy and tactics to humble the arrogance of the U.S. imperialists at a single blow.
					
					 The U.S. will have to pay dearly for any miscalculation of the DPRK's will and capability.
					
					 It should pay heed to the above-said warning.

articles.title: DPRK's Nuclear Test Is Measure for Self-defense: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK's Nuclear Test Is Measure for Self-defense: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The third underground nuclear test of the DPRK was a resolute measure for self-defence to cope with the high-handed hostile acts of the U.S. as it wantonly violated the legitimate right to satellite launch for peaceful purposes, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined article. 
					 The DPRK, world's military power and full-fledged nuclear weapons state, had neither need nor plan to conduct the nuclear test, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The nuclear deterrence of the DPRK had already possessed full capability for making a precision strike at any base of aggression and destroying it no matter where it is on the earth. 
					
					 The patience of the DPRK reached its limit when the U.S. escalated its hostile action by taking the lead in implementing the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions", far from making an apology for infringing upon the DPRK's right to launch satellites. 
					
					 The U.S. said it had no intention to invade the DPRK, but it put the DPRK on the list of targets of its preemptive nuclear attack. 
					
					 The DPRK withdrew from the NPT after going through necessary procedures to defend the supreme interests of the country and it opted for having access to nuclear deterrence for self-defence. 
					
					 The DPRK's recent nuclear test was the primary counteraction in which it exercised its maximum self-restraint. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK have an all-out action against the U.S. as it had solemnly declared before. 
					
					 The U.S. should not play down the word "all-out action." 
					
					 Now the U.S. stands at the crossroads of whether it will open a phase of detente and stability by respecting the DPRK's right to satellite launch or it will have final stand-off with the DPRK by persistently sticking to its hostile policy towards the latter.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Indian Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Indian Ambassador to DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Indian Ambassador to the DPRK Ajay Kumar Sharma at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Publishes Many Works on Sure Victory of Socialism
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Publishes Many Works on Sure Victory of Socialism
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Two decades have passed since general secretary Kim Jong Il published the work "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable".
					 The work, published on March 1, Juche 82 (1993), provides a great immortal programme as it indicates the way of defending and accomplishing the cause of socialism based on the principles of the Juche idea. 
					
					 He published many famous works which serve as guidelines for the victorious advance of the socialist cause since early in the 1990s when socialism collapsed in some countries owing to the moves of the imperialists and renegades and enemies' campaign against socialism got frantic.
					
					 He published "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable", "Socialism Is a Science", "Our Socialism Centred on the Masses Shall Not Perish" and "Socialism Is What Keeps Our People Alive"  and other works, opening up a new stage for accomplishing the cause of socialism.
					
					 The work "The Historical Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party" explains the basic reason why socialism collapsed in some countries and the historic lesson taught by it and underscores the need to strengthen the driving force of the revolution with a correct guiding idea.
					
					 There are also works including "Socialism in Our Country Is Korean-Style Socialism Guided by the Juche Idea" and "On Some Problems of the Ideological Foundation of Socialism" indicating the historic truth that socialism is sure to win when they hold fast to ideology, but if not, it fails. 
					
					 Other works indicate the tasks and ways to give full play to the might of the self-supporting national economy and bring about miracles and innovations in economic construction and clarify principled issues arising in the struggle to uphold and accomplish the cause of socialism with the might of the unity.
					
					 There are also works clarifying the idea that it is possible to firmly protect the dignity and honor of the socialist country and successfully build a thriving nation when the country strengthens the army and learns from the revolutionary soldier spirit.

articles.title: DPRK Servicepersons Ready for Showdown with U.S. Imperialists
articles.content:
DPRK Servicepersons Ready for Showdown with U.S. Imperialists
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The servicepersons of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea are enraged at the U.S. and its followers' persistent anti-DPRK policy, including planned war exercises.
					 They have warned that the U.S. would only face self-destruction if it finally launch a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK, egging its followers on to the reckless anti-DPRK actions.
					
					 Pak Ho Myong, an officer of the Strategic Rocket Force of the Korean People's Army, told KCNA:
					
					 "The U.S. imperialists have accused the DPRK of its peaceful satellite launch and self-defensive nuclear test. And they are going to start 'Key Resolve' and 'Foal Eagle' joint military maneuvers on March 1, despite the strong protest of the DPRK and the world public.
					
					 The DPRK already gave a warning to them that they would be doomed to death if they ignite a war of aggression while staging such maneuvers.
					
					 The powerful revolutionary Paektusan army has already rounded off its preparedness for a decisive battle to destroy the U.S., den of aggressors, and bases of its followers at one stroke."
					
					 Choe Su Gil, an officer of the KPA Air and Anti-Air Force, said:
					
					 "The enemies' call for preemptive attack on the DPRK is tantamount to digging their own graves.
					
					 The world will soon witness what results those warmongers will meet.
					
					 If the U.S. persistently seeks a nuclear war, oblivious of the bitter lesson taught by the Korean War in the 1950s, we will annihilate the aggressors with powerful nuclear weapons of Korean style."
					
					 Han Nam Su, an officer of the KPA, said:
					
					 "The army and people of the DPRK, rallied closer around respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, will lead the final showdown with the U.S. imperialists to victory and then build a most powerful and prosperous nation in the Korean Peninsula."

articles.title: Second-Phase Construction of Huichon Power Station Progresses Apace in DPRK
articles.content:
Second-Phase Construction of Huichon Power Station Progresses Apace in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The second-phase construction of the Huichon Power Station is progressing apace in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. The power station is being built in tiers on the River Chongchon
					 Builders from across the country, including the Thaechon Hydroelectric Power Station Construction Company, set about the excavation and filling work all at once.
					
					 Those from Pyongyang City carried out five blasts in a day to the maximum, moving away nearly 1,000 cubic meters of bedrock, earth and sand.
					
					 Builders from South Phyongan Province finished 10 percent of the ground excavation work for a generator building in some 20 days after they began buckling down to the project.
					
					 The Ministry of Railways is in charge of the cofferdam project needed for generator building, inlet channel and drainage projects.
					
					 South Hwanghae and South Hamgyong provinces sped up ground excavation for generator buildings while Jagang Province made upsurge in tunneling and drainage construction.

articles.title: Bean Lecithin Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Bean Lecithin Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Koryo Medicine Technical Center in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has succeeded in extracting lecithin from beans.
					 Lecithin was found to be a major subsidiary nutrient in recent years. This substance had been known to be contained only in the yolk of egg or animal's brain.
					
					 After scores of experiments, researchers of the Center invented a method of extracting lecithin from beans, putting its production on a scientific basis.
					
					 The bean lecithin is applicable to foodstuff and chemical industries as nutrient, emulsifier and antioxidant, according to Ri Ok Se, an 82-year-old researcher of the Center.

articles.title: Korean in U.S. Accuse Japan of Suppressing Chongryon
articles.content:
Korean in U.S. Accuse Japan of Suppressing Chongryon
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- An editor of Minjok Thongsin, an internet paper of Koreans in the United States, published an article on Feb. 23 accusing the Japanese government of its inhuman suppression of Koreans in Japan.
					 Slamming the Abe government for cracking down on Koreans in Japan under the pretext of the north's nuclear test, the article continued:
					
					 It barred vice-chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) from visiting the homeland and decided to exclude only the Korean schools operated by Chongryon from the application of the tuition free program for senior high schools. Moreover, local self-governing bodies including those in Kanagawa and Saitama prefectures suspended the payment of subsidies to Korean schools.
					
					 Japanese police searched a company of Korean businessman in Japan and his house for the mere reason that he sent goods to the north. Rightist gangsters thronged to Chongryon offices and Korean schools in different areas, shouting "Kill all Koreans".
					
					 Japan's behaviour is touching off criticism of the international community.
					
					 We Koreans in the U.S. vehemently denounce the Japanese government for resorting to frantic national discrimination in disregard of international law, ethics and morality, while suppressing Koreans in Japan by codifying even discrimination against the education of their children. 
					
					 We can hardly repress resentment at the Japanese imperialists when thinking of the pain inflicted by them upon the Korean nation, the article said, urging the Japanese authorities to stop inhumane suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan and apologize for it at an early date.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization's Action Program for This Year Confirmed
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization's Action Program for This Year Confirmed
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Taejon Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration held a regular meeting in Taejon on Feb. 21 and confirmed this year's action program.
					 At the meeting speakers said that the organization would hold diverse events on the occasion of anniversaries of the north-south joint declarations this year, including marathon race for reunification and seminar on education in reunification.
					
					 They said the organization would set the days from June 15 to July 27 as a "period for getting a peace treaty concluded" and conduct all-people information activities for peace against war.
					
					 A resolution was read out at the meeting.
					
					 It said that the unreasonable "sanctions" against the DPRK would lead to confrontation and war, warning that if a war breaks out on the Korean Peninsula, it will go over to a nuclear war and bring disasters to the nation.
					
					 It called for conducting positive activities for getting a peace treaty concluded and achieving national reconciliation and cooperation under the uplifted banner of peace against war.
					
					 It demanded south Korean and U.S. authorities stop at once joint military exercises Key Resolve and Foal Eagle.
					
					 It urged the south Korean authorities to cancel the "May 24 step" and opt for implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Education in S. Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Education in S. Korea under Fire 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities' intensified anti-DPRK education of children is now sparking off big concern from people of different social standings. 
					 The Ministry of Education, Science and Technology of south Korea on Feb. 13 sent an official document calling for working out "a plan for educating students in security" to primary, middle and high schools across south Korea in a bid to step up education inciting the north-south confrontation.
					
					 To this end, the Seoul City Education Agency on Feb. 19 concluded an agreement with some institutions and set about intensifying "education in security". 
					
					According to the agreement, those institutions are busy conducting education in confrontation with the north with human scum who defected from the north involved. 
					
					 The conservative organizations are also busy conducting the anti- DPRK smear campaign through special lectures on such themes as "clear understanding of the nuclear test in the north".
					
					 In this regard, a middle school principal in Seoul said that this atmosphere indicates the repetition of the education conducted to implant confrontation conception into the minds of students during the past dictatorship regime. This is creating serious uneasiness as it instills the unilateral idea inciting confrontation with the north, the school head added.

articles.title: Unconditional Release of Prisoners of Conscience Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Unconditional Release of Prisoners of Conscience Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Joint Action for Releasing Prisoners of Conscience in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Feb. 26 in demand of the release of the prisoners of conscience.
					 Speakers said at the conference there took place a series of pardon in the five years of the Lee Myung Bak regime's office but not a single prisoner of conscience was pardoned.
					
					 All the prisoners of conscience who were arrested while struggling for independent reunification and the vital rights should be pardoned immediately, they demanded.
					
					 The organization issued a declaration.
					
					 The declaration said the Lee regime ruthlessly suppressed the people under the pretext of "establishing legal order," thus inflicting unbearable pain and sufferings upon them.
					
					 Many people were unreasonably thrown behind bars on the strength of such anti-human rights law as the "Security Law" and thousands of prisoners of conscience are now forced to live a subhuman life in cold prisons, it noted.
					
					 It is hypocritical to force ordinary people to abide by law, while unhesitatingly granting special pardon to criminals backed by power, it said, demanding the authorities unconditionally release all the prisoners of conscience.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Slammed for Sowing Seeds of Discord between DPRK, China
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Slammed for Sowing Seeds of Discord between DPRK, China 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, issued a statement titled "Let us shatter south Korean puppet regime's moves for sowing seeds of discord between the DPRK and China" on Feb. 23.
					 All the Koreans in China cannot repress the surging resentment at the south Korean puppet regime unhesitatingly resorting to base smear campaign for sowing the seeds of discord between the DPRK and China, not content with escalating the confrontation with the DPRK over its third underground nuclear test, the statement said.
					
					 The south Korean regime released the false report by using even videos containing footage of protests which took place in China in the past, events utterly irrelevant to the bilateral relations, it noted, and went on:
					
					 This is aimed at sowing the seeds of discord between the DPRK and China and justifying the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" and thus realizing the ambition for confrontation with the DPRK at any cost.
					
					 The ridiculous racket kicked up by the regime, utterly indifferent to the destiny of the nation, clearly shows once again that it is only keen to realize the wild ambition to stand in confrontation with fellow countrymen to the last with the backing of foreign forces.
					
					 The south Korean regime should stop acting rashly, well aware that no matter what desperate anti-DPRK racket it may kicks up, it is fated to meet a disgraceful end only, the  statement warned.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage Field Mobile Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage Field Mobile Drill
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The 6th Division of the south Korean puppet army is mulling staging a field mobile drill in the area of Tongsong township of Cholwon County, south Korean Kangwon Province from March 4 to 8, south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					 The warmongers said it is aimed to increase combined operation capability to cope with a local war and total war. It was reported that tanks, helicopters and other huge armed forces and even civilians would be involved in the drill.
					
					 Availing themselves of the U.S. imperialists' "sanctions" racket against the DPRK, the south Korean warmongers are going more reckless with war maneuvers for invading the DPRK in a bid to ignite a war at any cost.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities Denounced for Discriminating against Korean Schools
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities Denounced for Discriminating against Korean Schools 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Council of Principals of Korean High Schools, the Liaison Council of Mothers of Korean Schools and the Liaison Council of Students of Korean Senior High School held a press conference in Tokyo on Feb. 25 in protest against the Japanese government's decision to exclude the Korean schools from the tuition-free program for senior high schools.
					 A joint statement was read out at the conference.
					
					 It said that the Abe government and the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan amended the ministry's directive on applying tuition free program for senior high schools and excluded the Korean schools from it.
					
					 This decision triggered off stronger criticism and opposition among people of different social standings including political, media, judicial circles of Japan and international organizations, it said, and went on:
					
					 The government of Japan, assailant, continues discriminating against even the descendants of Koreans in Japan, far from redressing its past crimes before them, victims of the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists. This is an unpardonable inhuman action unprecedented in the world.
					
					 The Abe government and the ministry should cancel the unreasonably amended directive at once and apply the tuition-free program to Korean schools at an early date.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 The speakers said that the UN Committee on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination recently expressed concern over the Japan's exclusion of Korean schools from the tuition-free program.
					
					 The program is purely an issue of education, they said, accusing the Japanese government of regarding Korean schools as hostage, linking the program to politics.
					
					 They stressed they would wage a dynamic struggle against the Japanese government's ceaseless moves for suppressing Chongryon and obliterating national education.

articles.title: Japan's Suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan Slammed
articles.content:
Japan's Suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan Slammed 
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in a statement on Thursday denounced the Japanese reactionary authorities for their harsh suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 The statement branded the suppression as an unpardonable provocation against the DPRK, an intolerable insult to the Korean nation and a crime wantonly violating international law, ethics and morality.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 As known, the Japanese reactionaries took the additional "sanctions" measures of banning the reentry into Japan of senior officials of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon by taking the advantage of the U.S. moves for "sanctions" on the DPRK. They excluded Korean schools only from the list of tuition free program for senior high schools and suspended the payment of subsidies to Korean schools. They are launching a wholesale search operation against Korean businessmen and enterprises, groundlessly charging that they sent goods to the DPRK.
					
					 They prodded ultra-right gangsters to go on the rampage at Chongryon offices and Korean schools. The gangsters shouted "they would kill all Koreans", creating a terror-ridden atmosphere.
					
					 Such moves are aimed at the monstrous massacre of Koreans that was committed during the great Kanto quake 90 years ago.
					
					 The recent crackdown stepped up by the Japanese reactionaries is prompted by their intention to obstruct the Koreans in Japan from conducting righteous activities for national reunification and stamp out Chongryon organizations.
					
					 Their reckless act of the Japanese reactionaries is a despicable act to revenge on the DPRK by suppressing Koreans in Japan as they were taken aback by the might of the DPRK, which is making steady victorious progress as a legitimate nuclear weapons state and a country manufacturing and launching satellites recognized by the world. Their act only reveals their bad habit and inhumane and unethical nature.
					
					 The DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes was the independent right of a sovereign state recognized by international law, and the DPRK's nuclear test was also a very just measure for self-defence aimed to defend the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Asia from the U.S. nuclear war moves against the DPRK. Japan is not entitled to find fault with the DPRK's measures and do harm to Chongryon and Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are acting as a shock brigade in supporting the U.S. "sanctions" racket against the DPRK. This exposes their disgusting nature as a stooge serving the U.S. master.
					
					 Japan should clearly understand that Korea is not a weak nation as it used to be in the past when it accepted Japan's colonial rule as a fate. Japan should stop running wild and immediately discontinue reckless suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should bear in mind that their reckless involvement in the U.S. racket for "sanctions" on the DPRK and their persistent suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan will bring them merciless punishment by all the Koreans.

articles.title: Japan's Antagonism towards Koreans Runs Higher
articles.content:
Japan's Antagonism towards Koreans Runs Higher
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government is nowadays intensifying the discrimination against the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and other Korean residents.
					 The discrimination, prompted by Japan's inherent national chauvinism, has evoked surging wrath of all Koreans as it is getting evermore pronounced in its hostile policy toward the DPRK while persistently refusing to settle its past woven with hideous crimes.
					
					 Historically, Japan has inflicted tremendous sufferings upon the Korean nation.
					
					 During its colonial rule over Korea, it took away millions of Koreans to Japan and forced slave labor upon them.
					
					 In this regard, the Fact-Finding Group for the Probe into the Truth behind the Forcible Drafting of Koreans, organized in the early 1970s with Japan-resident Koreans, Japanese lawyers and scholars, set up its regional branches in all parts of Japan to make a survey of the crimes related to the forcible drafting of Koreans and the forced labor.
					
					 The survey testified to the fact that there were more than 14,470 Korean draftees in Akita, nearly 20,000 in Kanagawa, some 69,000 in Chiba and more than 20,000 in Osaka prefectures. These figures are no more than a tip of iceberg in proportion to the number of all Koreans drafted to work for building 549 underground structures, at 1 500 industrial establishments, military base construction sites and even in farms across Japan.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Japanese imperialists massacred Korean draftees in most sinister and vicious way.
					
					 According to a survey report, more than 60,000 draftees were killed in coal mines of Japan from 1940-1944. The Imperial Japanese Army slaughtered at least 5,000 in Kuril Islands and 500 at the construction site of Matsushiro air-raid shelter for reasons of military secrets.
					
					 At the time of the great Kanto earthquake in September 1923, the Japanese imperialists murdered some 23 000 innocent Koreans, alleging that Koreans set fire to buildings.
					
					 The incident of the explosion of "Ukishima-maru", with Koreans returning home after the country's liberation aboard, gives a glimpse of Japan's brutal atrocities against the Koreans. The incident was disclosed to be a premeditated and intentional one.
					
					 Japan can by no means flee from the responsibility for the massacres of Koreans as they are state-sponsored crimes of the blackest dye that can never be justified.
					
					 Japan should repent of its crime-woven history with a sense of its legal and moral obligations.

articles.title: Russian Paper Calls for Giving DPRK Security Assurances
articles.content:
Russian Paper Calls for Giving DPRK Security Assurances 
						
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Nezabisimaya Gazetta on Feb. 22 carried an article subtitled "DPRK is compelled to develop nukes" under the headline "Self-defense".
					 Querying why does the DPRK need A-bombs, the article said:
					
					 The answer is clear. It is to defend the country and its social and political system and its power from the pressure and aggression by outside forces.
					
					 This point was mentioned in the statement issued by a spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK right after its nuclear test. 
					
					 One must ponder over the statement.
					
					 Everybody cannot but recognize the justice of the decisive measure taken by the DPRK to defend the security of the country.
					
					 It is entirely just when taking into consideration the historical experience everybody witnessed.
					
					 Citing facts to prove that some countries could not escape a miserable fate as they lacked means for defending themselves, it went on:
					
					 Everybody is clearly witnessing for himself what is happening in those countries.
					
					 The DPRK is regarding it as the only capability for defending its own security to have access to nukes.
					
					 That is why it is clear political logic that the DPRK can never abandon its nuclear program.
					
					 Tightening sanctions would not help settle the nuclear issue, the article noted, adding that the only way is to give the DPRK legal assurances that force would neither be used against it nor its present social system toppled.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by British Organization, Regional Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by British Organization, Regional Body
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- A British organization and a regional organization released statements on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a statement on February 15, saying that Kim Jong Il was a great leader in the era of independence who devoted all his life to the happiness of the people and the accomplishment of the cause of global independence.
					
					 He has turned the DPRK into a powerful nation of independence, the statement noted.
					
					 Many countries and even some big powers are becoming victims and playthings of the U.S. strategy of hegemony but only the DPRK is holding high the banner of independence, it said, adding this is because the DPRK is firmly adhering to the principle of independence in politics, self-support in the economy and self-reliance in national defence, guided by the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and developed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK is now steadfastly advancing according to its viewpoint and decision, not reading other's face, it noted, and went on:
					
					 The independence of the DPRK is the most valuable legacy bequeathed by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 His cause is being successfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Arab Committee for Solidarity with Korean People and Supporting the Reunification of Korea said in a statement on February 7 that the Korean people feel proud of their country and confident of the future, adding that celebrating his birth anniversary is of great significance.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- A meeting, photo exhibition and film show took place in Cuba, a meeting in Portugal and a photo exhibition in Iran on Feb. 16 and 21 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were photos on immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also on display there were photos showing the invincible might of Songun Korea.
					
					 Participants in film shows watched Korean film "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation."
					
					 Present at the events were figures of the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples, the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the Portuguese Branch of the Korean Friendship Association and the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran and masses.
					
					 Juan Jose Leon Vega, first vice-chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, said that Kim Jong Il pursued Songun politics, firmly defending socialism and laying a solid foundation for achieving the prosperity of the country and improving the people's standard of living.
					
					 He wished the dear respected Kim Jong Un success in his work for achieving the prosperity of the DPRK, true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The deputy general secretary of the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran wished the friendly Korean people greater successes, adding that they are waging a dynamic struggle for building a thriving nation, single-mindedly united around the leader despite the imperialists' moves.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Marked in Denmark, Bulgaria, Bangladesh
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Marked in Denmark, Bulgaria, Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- A joint meeting took place in Denmark and meetings in Bulgaria and Bangladesh on Feb. 14 and 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 On display in the venues of the meetings were photos on the noble revolutionary careers and undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerlessly great men and books introducing the DPRK.
					
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said that Kim Jong Il was a great revolutionary and outstanding elder statesman who devoted his whole life to the prosperity of socialist Korea and the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and the sacred cause of global independence.
					
					 Atanas Ivanov, honorary chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union, and other speakers said that thanks to the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il, the DPRK could achieve brilliant successes in all fields, winning victory after victory under the uplifted banner of socialism.
					
					 M. Gamrul Huda, chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Jong Il was the greatest man as he was possessed of the personality and disposition as a great man on the highest level and the peerless master of politics who led the Workers' Party of Korea, the army and the people to the road of steady victory with his profound ideas and theories and extraordinary leadership.
					
					 Messages of greeting to the dear respected Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events in Denmark and Bulgaria.

articles.title: Swedish Political Party's Organ Condemns U.S. Hostile Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
Swedish Political Party's Organ Condemns U.S. Hostile Policy towards DPRK
Pyongyang, February 28 (KCNA) -- The 7th issue of Proretaren, organ of the Communist Party of Sweden, carried a commentary titled "Nuke and threat" in denunciation of the West's racket to stifle the DPRK and hypocrisy over its nuclear test.
					 The commentary said:
					
					 In the wake of the nuclear test conducted by the DPRK, the West unanimously made uproar, describing its nukes as more dangerous than those of other countries.
					
					 Who on earth is threatening whom?
					
					 Where were those angered commentators when the U.S. subs and other warships were deployed in the waters off the Korean Peninsula last week for naval maneuvers with the south Korean navy.
					
					 Still fresh in people's memory is hysteric reaction to the DPRK's satellite launch in Dec. last year.
					
					 A peace treaty has not yet been concluded on the peninsula after the ceasefire. In other words, it is technically at war still now.
					
					 Responsibility for this rests with the U.S. which is opposed to the signing of the peace treaty despite the efforts of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. is interested in maintaining tension in this region for geopolitical reason.
					
					 During the Korean War the U.S. worked out a plan to use nukes against the DPRK.
					
					 After the war, it deployed nukes in south Korea, and the DPRK was on the list of the targets of U.S. nuclear attack.
					
					 The U.S. is the only country which declared the offensive nuclear war strategy.
					
					 We should view the DPRK's plan for the development of nukes for self-defence in the light of these facts.
					
					 The U.S. dares not invade the DPRK as it has nukes.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia regalo a Jindallae Saphariny
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia regalo a Jindallae Saphariny
 Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio presente a la presidenta del Fondo para la Infancia Jindallae, Jindallae Saphariny felicitando su boda.
					 El regalo fue entregado a ella el dia 27 por el embajador de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en China, Ji Jae Ryong.
					
					 Emocionada por tal venevolencia, la presidenta deseo de todo corazon al Mariscal buena salud.
					
					 Expreso su determinacion de esforzarse tambien en el futuro por profundizar la amistad con el pueblo coreano.

articles.title: Dennis Rodman y su comitiva rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Dennis Rodman y su comitiva rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ACNC) -- El jugador retirado de NBA (Asociacion Nacional de Baloncesto) de Estados Unidos, Dennis Rodman, y su comitiva visitaron el dia 28 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan y rindieron el sublime homenaje a los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il en el hall donde se hallan sus estatuas de pie y los salones de eternidad donde se conservan sus cuerpos.
					 Tambien pasaron revista a las salas de conservacion de las ordenes, el hall de llanto y las salas de autos, carro electrico, barco y vagones de tren, utilizados por los Generalisimos hasta el ultimo momento de su vida en el camino de orientacion sobre el terreno y visita al extranjero.
					
					 Los huespedes norteamericanos dejaron letras en el libro de visitas.

articles.title: Provocador al pais con armas nucleares sufrira el arruinamiento, advierte ACNC
articles.content:
Provocador al pais con armas nucleares sufrira el arruinamiento, advierte ACNC
 Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ACNC) -- La tercera prueba nuclear de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea es el digno ejercicio de soberania frente al acto hostil de Estados Unidos que infringio flagrantemente hasta el derecho legitimo de un Estado soberano al lanzamiento de satelite con fines pacificos. 
					 A pesar de esto, el imperio sigue tratando de presionar a la RPDC calificandola de "desafio" a la sociedad internacional e insistiendo en asestar el "ataque preventivo nuclear" contra ella. 
					
					 Desde el dia primero de marzo intenta desplegar otra vez en el suelo surcoreano los ejercicios de guerra nuclear como "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" introduciendo la flotilla de portaaviones nucleares, los aviones "B-52" y otros pertrechos belicos ultramodernos. 
					
					 Esto es una accion peligrosa tendente a provocar en la Peninsula Coreana la guerra nuclear nadando a contrapelo de la aspiracion a la paz y estabilidad de la region.
					
					 Tal movimiento militar va a realizarse en estos momentos en que la confrontacion RPDC- EE.UU. ha llegado a la extremidad, lo que evidencia que la politica de guerra nuclear anti-RPDC de EE.UU., mantenida siglo tras siglo, ya se ha entrado en la etapa de practica, o sea, en la guerra real. 
					
					 Se cierne en la Peninsula Coreana el nubarron de la guerra nuclear. 
					
					 Los enemigos intentan encubrir el caracter criminal de sus simulacros con el rotulo de "entrenamientos anuales de caracter defensivo" y "aviso previo", pero no podra enganar a la RPDC. 
					
					 EE.UU. debe conocer bien a su contraparte. 
					
					 El pueblo coreano no es el de hace un siglo en que sufria el destino de apatrida por ser privado del territorio patrio por las grandes potencias, sino es el heroico que vencio en una generacion a las dos potencias imperialistas norteamericana y japonesa.
					
					 Con la absoluta confianza en su ideologia,  regimen y causa y con la decision de defenderlos a riesgo de la vida, declaro solemnemente que aniquilara completamente a quienes los atenten, aunque esten en cualquier rincon de nuestro planeta.
					
					 En el tiempo pasado la RPDC vino logrando siempre victorias sin armas nucleares. 
					
					 Pues, en la actualidad en que ella cuenta con armas nucleares, EE.UU. debe reflexionarse de la consecuencia de la provocacion contra ella.
					
					 La reciente prueba nuclear es la primera contramedida tomada con maxima paciencia frente al acto hostil de EE.UU. 
					
					 La RPDC ya demostro en la practica su voluntad y capacidad.
					
					 Ahora las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias coreanas, decididas a eliminar completamente el baluarte de agresion poniendo de pleno manifiesto su inagotable poderio combativo, esperan la orden de ataque final manteniendo la disposicion combativa. 
					
					 Ya tenemos la estrategia y los metodos al estilo coreano para aniquilar de un golpe al arrogante imperialismo norteamericano. 
					
					 Pagara muy caro el calculo erroneo sobre la voluntad y capacidad de la RPDC. 
					
					 EE.UU. debe prestar atencion a nuestra advertencia.

articles.title: Periodico sueco condena campana anti-RPDC del Occidente en torno a prueba nuclear
articles.content:
Periodico sueco condena campana anti-RPDC del Occidente en torno a prueba nuclear
 Pyongyang, 28 de febrero (ACNC) -- El organo del Partido Comunista de Suecia Proretaren divulgo en su numero 7 un comentario intitulado "Armas nucleares y amenaza" que condena la campana del Occidente para aplastar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea acusandola por la reciente prueba nuclear.
					 El texto va como sigue:
					
					 Cuando la RPDC realizo la prueba nuclear, el Occidente expresa unanimemente su "indignacion" como si armas nucleares de ella fueran mas peligrosas que las de otros paises.
					
					 Entonces, ?quien es el que amenaza y quien es el amenazado?
					
					 ?Donde estaban los comentaristas encolerizados de hoy cuando los buques de guerra norteamericanos, inclusive el submarino nuclear, entraron la semana pasada en la Peninsula Coreana con fin de participar en los ejercicios navales conjuntos con el Sur de Corea?
					
					 Sigue fresca todavia en la memoria la reaccion histerica al lanzamiento del satelite artificial de la Tierra por parte de la RPDC en diciembre pasado.
					
					 En la Peninsula Coreana no se ha firmado todavia un convenio de paz despues de la pasada guerra coreana. Es decir, se mantiene en el estado de guerra.
					
					 La responsabilidad recae enteramente sobre EE.UU. que rechaza la firma del convenio de paz desestimando los esfuerzos de la RPDC.
					
					 Partiendo del factor geopolitico, EE.UU. esta interesado en mantener tensiones en esa region.
					
					 Durante la guerra coreana, EE.UU. tenia el plan de usar armas nucleares contra la RPDC.
					
					 Terminada la guerra, el imperio desplego armas nucleares en el territorio surcoreano y alisto a la RPDC en sus blancos de ataque nuclear.
					
					 EE.UU. es el unico pais que declaro la estrategia de guerra nuclear de caracter ofensivo.
					
					 Habria que evaluar el programa de desarrollo de armas nucleares para la autodefensa de la RPDC tomando en cuenta los referidos antecedentes.
					
					 EE.UU. no se atreve a agredir a la RPDC porque ella posee artefactos nucleares.
